title: Week 1: Introduction to Big Data and Its Architecture
description: Overview of big data concepts, architectures, and challenges, with a focus on understanding basic definitions and characteristics of big data.

title: Week 2: Hadoop Ecosystem
description: Introduction to Hadoop, HDFS, YARN, and components of the Hadoop ecosystem, enabling students to explain the functionalities of each component.

title: Week 3: MapReduce Programming Model
description: Understanding MapReduce concepts and developing simple programs, allowing students to create basic MapReduce applications.

title: Week 4: Introduction to Apache Spark
description: Overview of Spark architecture, RDDs, and transformations, focusing on explaining Spark's advantages over MapReduce.

title: Week 5: Data Processing with Spark
description: Using Spark for batch data processing, DataFrames, and Spark SQL, with an emphasis on implementing data processing tasks.

title: Week 6: Advanced Spark Programming
description: Exploration of advanced Spark APIs, optimizations, and best practices, aimed at optimizing Spark applications for performance.

title: Week 7: Introduction to Streaming Data
description: Concepts of stream processing and associated challenges, providing fundamental knowledge about streaming data processing.

title: Week 8: Working with Apache Kafka
description: Kafka architecture, topics, producers, and consumers, enabling students to build applications for real-time data ingestion.

title: Week 9: Spark Streaming and Real-Time Analytics
description: Integrating Spark with Kafka and processing streaming data to implement Spark Streaming applications.

title: Week 10: Machine Learning Basics
description: Introduction to machine learning in a big data context, focusing on understanding fundamental machine learning concepts.

title: Week 11: Scalable Machine Learning with MLlib
description: Using Spark's MLlib for machine learning tasks, allowing students to apply machine learning algorithms with Spark.

title: Week 12: Evaluating Machine Learning Models
description: Model evaluation metrics and techniques, enabling students to assess and select appropriate metrics for evaluating models.

title: Week 13: Capstone Project Preparation
description: Guidelines for the final project, team formation, and project milestones, helping students develop a project plan.

title: Week 14: Capstone Project Development
description: In-class project work and mentorship sessions, allowing students to collaborate on project deliverables.

title: Week 15: Final Project Presentations
description: Presentation of final projects and peer evaluations, focusing on effectively communicating project findings.
